<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/main/lib/cucumber/runtime/support_code.rb | support_code.rb>
<pre><code> log.debug("Code:\n") </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
luke
2021-12-15 06:59:49

this is the line now which gets executed "by default" using latest rubymine (Which is 10+ years old and written by our very own matt wynne).

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-12-15 07:00:02

And here: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/main/lib/cucumber/cli/configuration.rb

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/main/lib/cucumber/cli/configuration.rb | configuration.rb>
<pre><code># frozen_string_literal: true require 'logger' require 'cucumber/cli/options' require 'cucumber/cli/rerun_file' require 'cucumber/constantize' require 'cucumber' module Cucumber module Cli class YmlLoadError &amp;lt; StandardError; end class ProfilesNotDefinedError &amp;lt; YmlLoadError; end class ProfileNotFound &amp;lt; StandardError; end class Configuration include Constantize attr_reader :out_stream def initialize(out_stream = $stdout, error_stream = $stderr) @out_stream = out_stream @error_stream = error_stream @options = Options.new(@out_stream, @error_stream, default_profile: 'default') end def parse!(args) @args = args @options.parse!(args) arrange_formats raise("You can't use both --strict and --wip") if strict.strict? &amp;amp;&amp;amp; wip? set_environment_variables end def verbose? @options[:verbose] end def randomize? @options[:order] == 'random' end def seed Integer(@options[:seed] || rand(0xFFFF)) end def strict @options[:strict] end def wip? @options[:wip] end def guess? @options[:guess] end def dry_run? @options[:dry_run] end def expand? @options[:expand] end def fail_fast? @options[:fail_fast] end def retry_attempts @options[:retry] end def snippet_type @options[:snippet_type] || :cucumber_expression end def log logger = Logger.new(@out_stream) logger.formatter = LogFormatter.new logger.level = Logger::INFO logger.level = Logger::DEBUG if verbose? logger end def tag_limits @options[:tag_limits] end def tag_expressions @options[:tag_expressions] end def name_regexps @options[:name_regexps] end def filters @options.filters end def formats @options[:formats] end def paths @options[:paths] end def to_hash Hash(@options).merge(out_stream: @out_stream, error_stream: @error_stream, seed: seed) end private class LogFormatter &amp;lt; ::Logger::Formatter def call(_severity, _time, _progname, msg) msg end end def set_environment_variables @options[:env_vars].each do |var, value| ENV[var] = value end end def arrange_formats add_default_formatter if needs_default_formatter? @options[:formats] = @options[:formats].sort_by do |f| f[2] == @out_stream ? -1 : 1 end @options[:formats].uniq! @options.check_formatter_stream_conflicts end def add_default_formatter @options[:formats] &amp;lt;&amp;lt; ['pretty', {}, @out_stream] end def needs_default_formatter? formatter_missing? || publish_only? end def formatter_missing? @options[:formats].empty? end def publish_only? @options[:formats] .uniq .map { |formatter, _, stream| [formatter, stream] } .uniq .reject { |formatter, stream| formatter == 'message' &amp;amp;&amp;amp; stream != @out_stream } .empty? end end end end </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>

2021-12-15 07:00:34

but basically the default execute command from RubyMine now has changed.

luke
2021-12-15 07:01:04

Default command is now

/bin/bash -c "/usr/share/rvm/bin/rvm ruby-3.0.2 do /usr/share/rvm/rubies/ruby-3.0.2/bin/ruby -x /usr/share/rvm/gems/ruby-3.0.2/bin/bundle exec /usr/share/rvm/rubies/ruby-3.0.2/bin/ruby -EUTF-8 /usr/share/rvm/gems/ruby-3.0.2/gems/ruby-debug-ide-0.7.3/bin/rdebug-ide --key-value --disable-int-handler --evaluation-timeout 10 --evaluation-control --time-limit 100 --memory-limit 0 --rubymine-protocol-extensions --port 34875 --host 0.0.0.0 --dispatcher-port 38483 -- /usr/share/rvm/gems/ruby-3.0.2/bin/cucumber /home/luke/Code/web-automation/features/investor_platform/core/login.feature --format 'Teamcity::Cucumber::Formatter' --expand --name 'Load login page' --verbose --color -r features"

luke
2021-12-15 07:01:08

note the last bit that has verbose

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-12-15 07:04:27

I don't think I have EVER used --verbose. I think we should consider removing the logger code, and possibly deprecate the --verbose option...

luke
2021-12-15 09:04:17

yeh agreed 🙂 It's weird as hell.

luke
2021-12-15 09:04:22

olleolleolle
2022-01-15 00:46:42

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/pull/526#issuecomment-1013644019 The failures they look like a pattern I saw elsewhere: using Psych 4.0 the arity to safe_load had changed, so the previous usage with positional parameters is now expected to be different. I guess/wager an upgrade of Rubygems for Ruby 2.5, perhaps also 2.6 will bypass some of that

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/pull/526#issuecomment-1013644019|Comment on #526 Add Rails 7 support>
<p>Hi, I can see that <a href="https://github.com/mgrunberg/cucumber-rails/runs/4824503004?check_suite_focus=true">specs are failing</a> against Ruby 2.5 but it looks like an issue not related to this change</p>

2022-04-13 15:16:14

https://twitter.com/mattwynne/status/1514364196967702528

twitter
Matt Wynne ✊🏿 (https://twitter.com/mattwynne/status/1514364196967702528)
I've gone down a rabbit hole trying to convert some old tests from Travis to GitHub Actions. They try multiple Gemfile configurations, so need to run `bundle install` multiple times during the test run. I'm at a loss why these gems won't install, e.g. <https://github.com/cucumber/multi_test/runs/6015497107?check_suite_focus=true>
Original URL: https://twitter.com/mattwynne/status/1514364196967702528
Twitter
matt-SmartBear
2022-04-13 17:32:56

*Thread Reply:* Sorted.

In the end I bit the bullet and re-did it using a build matrix that's aware of the gemfiles.

luke
2022-04-21 06:38:40

*Thread Reply:* use appraisal. I can help with this though. Got a bit of exp.

Or you can just use the regular matrix if you want.

Tbh with the new github ci stuff, appraisal can probably go

matt-SmartBear
2022-04-21 07:07:09

*Thread Reply:* I don't think appraisal will work - we need to know which Gemfile is being used to choose the right tests to run, and I can't see a way to do that with appraisal.

2022-05-19 08:21:01

*Thread Reply:* Now we just need to get cucumber-rails to bump their deps https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/blob/c71edb7a0cda20fff3918922f98d591280d72278/cucumber-rails.gemspec#L25

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/blob/c71edb7a0cda20fff3918922f98d591280d72278/cucumber-rails.gemspec | cucumber-rails.gemspec>
<pre><code> s.add_runtime_dependency('cucumber', ['&amp;gt;= 3.2', '&amp;lt; 8']) # Support cucumber in the 3.x &amp;lt;-&amp;gt; 7.x revision range </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails">cucumber/cucumber-rails</a>
matt-SmartBear
2022-06-09 07:45:59

I've been reminded by https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/issues/538 that we still can't use renovate for our Ruby projects. I did a little twitter trawl here to look for solutions.

RTs appreciated.

twitter
Matt Wynne ✊🏿 (https://twitter.com/mattwynne/status/1534908394774986752)
Has anyone figured out how to get automated dependency update PRs for a <b>#Ruby</b> gem project? (i.e. the dependencies are in a `.gemspec` file not a `Gemfile`) <a href="https://twitter.com/renovatebot">@renovatebot</a> doesn't support `gemspec` files. As far as I can see <a href="https://twitter.com/dependabot">@dependabot</a> is the same.
Original URL: https://twitter.com/mattwynne/status/1534908394774986752
Twitter
matt-SmartBear
2022-06-09 15:40:32

Fixed it! Dependabot > Renovate in this instance!

matt-SmartBear
2022-06-09 15:55:09

Now we have Dependabot in cucumber-ruby and cucumber-rails! Does anyone have time to look through these PRs and work out what to do about them? They look non-trivial as we need to be able to run our tests against older Rails versions, which has impacts on what we can upgrade, it seems.

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/pulls

@olleolleolle looks like your kind of thing maybe? 😁

❤️ olleolleolle, Aslak Hellesøy

https://github.com/rails/rails-html-sanitizer/pull/139

<https://github.com/rails/rails-html-sanitizer/pull/139|#139 Introduce initial ruby version guard>
<p>This appears to be an issue from cucumber-rails testing.</p> <p>EDIT: I haven't spent hours and hours triaging. But I did reproduce this error a couple of times at ruby &lt; 2.6</p> <p>See: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/runs/6822054026?check_suite_focus=true#step:3:120">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/runs/6822054026?check<em>suite</em>focus=true#step:3:120</a></p> <p>EDIT2: In between the time dependabot made the PR for us and us merging the PR (Approx 5 days duration), a new version was cut in this gem (Which had this diff - <a href="https://github.com/rails/rails-html-sanitizer/compare/v1.4.2...v1.4.3">v1.4.2...v1.4.3</a>)</p>

2022-06-23 07:12:29

matt-SmartBear
2023-01-03 14:53:50

@luke it seems like we need to drop support for Ruby < 2.7

I'm going over our Ruby projects for https://github.com/cucumber/common/issues/2143 and getting a bunch of failures from the build for 2.6 or even 2.5 sometimes,

#2143 Dependabot => Renovate for Ruby projects
<p>Thanks to <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/issues/2142">#2142</a> we can get rid of DependaBot and use Renovate everywhere.</p> <p>Repos to check:</p> <p>☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/aruba">https://github.com/cucumber/aruba</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-expressions">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-expressions</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/gherkin">https://github.com/cucumber/gherkin</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/html-formatter">https://github.com/cucumber/html-formatter</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/messages">https://github.com/cucumber/messages</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/ci-environment">https://github.com/cucumber/ci-environment</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/aruba-getting-started">https://github.com/cucumber/aruba-getting-started</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/action-publish-rubygem">https://github.com/cucumber/action-publish-rubygem</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/compatibility-kit">https://github.com/cucumber/compatibility-kit</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/tag-expressions">https://github.com/cucumber/tag-expressions</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/multi_test">https://github.com/cucumber/multi_test</a> ☐ <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/demo-formatter">https://github.com/cucumber/demo-formatter</a></p> <p><https://github.com/orgs/cucumber/repositories?q=&amp;type=all&amp;language=ruby&amp;sort=|Full search for all Ruby repos> or <https://github.com/search?p=1&amp;q=topic%3Aruby+org%3Acucumber&amp;type=Repositories|tagged with <code>ruby</code>&gt;.</p>

luke
2023-08-09 06:47:24

Anyone paying attention will start to see a few PR's shooting up that look partially incomplete. These are a series of transitional PR's to get us to a state to release a v9 but also give me a chunk of backlog tidies I can do.

v9 will likely see a bunch of releases in the 9.0.x category whilst I tidy up a lot of stuff that has been left dead for a while.

luke
2023-08-09 08:39:05

NB: GHA issue here: https://github.com/ruby/setup-ruby/issues/518. Affects any/all repos with multiple ruby builds and gems whose latest version is only compatible in a sub-set of rubies.

luke
2023-09-01 04:30:04

@matt think we can delete most of the release workflow for testing. It is re-testing stuff that's auto triggered anyway by the regular pipeline.

Here is the test workflow. That runs 14x revisions on CI

matt
2023-09-01 08:23:32

*Thread Reply:* Running the tests again as part of the release process was a deliberate decision. I think it partly reflects Aurelien's cautious nature - even though the tests should have already been run on that commit, in theory it is possible for someone to accidentally push a commit with failing tests to the release branch. This "belt and braces" approach means such a commit would never actually make it to rubygems.

👍 luke
matt
2023-09-01 04:30:13

@matt has joined the channel

luke
2023-09-01 04:30:56

Here is the release workflow. That runs 13x revisions on CI

luke
2023-09-01 04:32:00

I can see that for the release workflow it waits until both have been completed before doing the next bit. So I'm not entirely sure how we can remove the duplicate runs. But there is bound to be a way

luke
2023-09-01 04:33:09

I think the reason it's doing this is because of the sequencing. We push a commit directly to main, which triggers the 2 workflows. Test and lint. Then we create a branch from main called release/x which runs just the 1 workflow.

luke
2023-09-01 08:02:17

Also I think something is up with the conditions because I set auto-merge here and it merged after 6/15 iterations had passed

matt
2023-09-01 08:25:05

*Thread Reply:* if you look at the main branch protection rules, you'll see we only added two of the checks - the ubuntu latest tests and (since yesterday) the rubocop checks. If we want to wait for all of the matrix tests to complete before an auto-merge, we need to add each of the different tests to that list.

luke
2023-09-01 08:25:30

*Thread Reply:* yeh I spotted that. On my other oss repos I didn't need to do this.

If we remove both will it auto set them all?

matt
2023-09-01 08:26:01

*Thread Reply:*

matt
2023-09-01 08:26:33

*Thread Reply:* I'm not sure. As far as I'm aware you have to add them all manually. It's a pain in the arse when you have a matrix like this with several builds. I never found a way to say "all of them".

luke
2023-09-01 08:24:49

☝️ I think there is only one "required" to pass condition. As I'm doing some fixes on the workflows to re-lint them and noticed this.

I'm not sure exactly how to fix it, so I've only slightly tweaked it.

mpkorstanje
2023-09-07 08:42:10

Pff. Figured it out. It's dynamic dependencies.

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-wire/blob/main/Gemfile

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-wire/blob/main/Gemfile | Gemfile>
<pre><code>source "&lt;https://rubygems.org&gt;" git_source(:github) { |repo| "&lt;https://github.com/#{repo}.git&gt;" } gemspec if ENV['CUCUMBER_RUBY_CORE'] gem 'cucumber-core', path: ENV['CUCUMBER_RUBY_CORE'] elsif !ENV['CUCUMBER_USE_RELEASED_GEMS'] gem 'cucumber-core', github: 'cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core', branch: 'main' end if ENV['CUCUMBER_RUBY'] gem 'cucumber', path: ENV['CUCUMBER_RUBY'] elsif !ENV['CUCUMBER_USE_RELEASED_GEMS'] gem 'cucumber', github: 'cucumber/cucumber-ruby', tag: 'v7.1.0' end gem 'aruba', github: 'cucumber/aruba', branch: 'main' # Waiting for a new release of aruba </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-wire">cucumber/cucumber-ruby-wire</a>

2023-09-07 08:42:20

mpkorstanje

brasmusson
2023-09-07 10:08:02

Cucumber-cpp, https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-cpp, still says it uses the wire protocol and requires cucumber-ruby.

cucumber/cucumber-cpp
Support for writing Cucumber step definitions in C++
Stars
287
Language
C++
👍 luke
luke
2023-09-08 01:08:15

v0.5 of cpp was released in 2018 and the gemfile in there references cucumber ruby v2 for internal testing (we're now in the v9.x series).

brasmusson
2023-09-08 01:44:49

Yes, I was a comment on the github page stating that cucucmber-cpp is not compatible with cucumber-ruby v3. However, using cucumber-cpp will use require use of cucumber-ruby (v2?) since cucumber-cpp only handles step definitions, the parsing of feature files, executing scenarios etc is done by cucucmber-ruby when using cucumber-cpp.

brasmusson
2023-09-08 01:47:16

When cucumber-cpp ever is updated there are two options, either to updated i so it could use the latest cucumber-ruby version, or to stop use cucumber-ruby and instead implement a full cucumber implementation in cpp.

luke
2023-09-08 01:49:12

oki, so the wire then is still technically needed there then. Good to know.

luke
2023-09-08 01:49:20

Tbh hardly anything is going into it, just keeping up updated e.t.c.

#566 Debug/v3
<p><strong>🤔 What's changed?</strong> <strong>⚡ What's your motivation?</strong> <strong>🏷️ What kind of change is this?</strong></p> <p>• 🏦 Refactoring/debt/DX (improvement to code design, tooling, documentation etc. without changing behaviour) • 🐛 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes a defect) • ⚡ New feature (non-breaking change which adds new behaviour) • 💥 Breaking change (incompatible changes to the API)</p> <p><strong>♻️ Anything particular you want feedback on?</strong> <strong>📋 Checklist:</strong></p> <p>☑︎ I agree to respect and uphold the <a href="https://cucumber.io/conduct/">Cucumber Community Code of Conduct</a> ☐ I've changed the behaviour of the code ☐ I have added/updated tests to cover my changes. ☐ My change requires a change to the documentation. ☐ I have updated the documentation accordingly. ☐ Users should know about my change ☐ I have added an entry to the "Unreleased" section of the &lt;../blob/main/CHANGELOG.md|<strong>CHANGELOG</strong>&gt;, linking to this pull request.</p> <hr /> <p><em>This text was originally generated from a <a href="https://docs.github.com/en/communities/using-templates-to-encourage-useful-issues-and-pull-requests/about-issue-and-pull-request-templates">template</a>, then edited by hand. <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/.github/edit/main/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md">You can modify the template here.</a></em></p>

Charlie Alderete
2023-12-20 12:26:46

For ci-environment I've gotten the rubocop todo file cleared in this PR https://github.com/cucumber/ci-environment/pull/241 Mostly I just used the autocorrect and made sure the rspec tests still passed.

For manual fixes I changed some rspec file names, moved dev dependancies to the gemfile and refactored some of the rspec tests. This is my first PR here 😅 so I hope I have not messed any protocols or anything

#241 Enabling rubo configs/12 20 23
<p><strong>🤔 What's changed?</strong></p> <p>Regenerated rubcop todo and fixed warnings.<br /> Added to rubocop config:</p> <p>Metrics/AbcSize:<br /> Max: 30</p> <p>Metrics/MethodLength:<br /> Max: 23</p> <p>RSpec/ExampleLength:<br /> Max: 6</p> <p><strong>⚡ What's your motivation?</strong></p> <p>Helping out</p> <p><strong>🏷️ What kind of change is this?</strong></p> <p>• 🏦 Refactoring/debt/DX (improvement to code design, tooling, documentation etc. without changing behaviour)</p> <p><strong>♻️ Anything particular you want feedback on?</strong></p> <p>I added some configs to rubocop.yml for code length. Should those be refactored to fit those cops instead?</p> <p><strong>📋 Checklist:</strong></p> <p>☑︎ I agree to respect and uphold the <a href="https://cucumber.io/conduct/">Cucumber Community Code of Conduct</a></p> <hr /> <p><em>This text was originally generated from a <a href="https://docs.github.com/en/communities/using-templates-to-encourage-useful-issues-and-pull-requests/about-issue-and-pull-request-templates">template</a>, then edited by hand. <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/.github/edit/main/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md">You can modify the template here.</a></em></p>

luke
2023-12-21 01:59:42

Hey @Charlie Alderete thanks for all the work. I probably didn't stress enough that you don't need to fix everything up. With 60+ offenses across multiple offenses it's often quite a laborious task to fix up everything.

Also with this gem there's quite a lot of stuff that was generated rather swiftly and should be refactored where appropriate - hence some of the metric scores being high. As an FYI it's fine not to fix these up. We shouldn't be moving the benchmarks for stuff we can try to improve.
